If you want using character attributes, using the Text Adventure version will supply you with very easy using tools. 

The principles behind it may be a little confusing for begginers, but all you need is find the object named player at the objects tree at left, mark it and proceed to player attributes. The you will find the stats attributes. Create the one you want and then type what will be displayed to the player. Down at attributes, you insert it again, but this time you will set the type of attribute it is. When you think of numbers, it is an Int.  If you think of a word of phrase, it is string type.

The upper part will tell Quest what to display. The lower part tells it what to store ad consult. 

In general terms, if you create an attribute named "strength " for the rest of the game Quest will see it as player.strength and if you create this attribute to an npc named Jacob, it will become Jacob . strength
